file_content.text: Makeb's not so bad once you solve the "exploding planet" problem.
With those satellites out of commission, maybe we'll save this planet after all.
Hope you neutralize those satellites soon. No telling what they'll blast next.
Wrath! Sergeant Bedareux. Truly honored, my lord. I just need a moment....
My lord. Sergeant Bedareux, at your service. Please grace me with one minute....
'Scuse me, hunter. Sergeant Bedareux. Have I got a job for you.
Commander! Sergeant Bedareux, Makeb Reconnaissance Unit. Glad I found you.
There you are! Sergeant Bedareux, taking over duties for Lord Cytharat. We need to talk.
Blast! It's happening again!
Orbital weapons satellites, right over our heads. They're firing on Makeb!
Firepower of that magnitude could scorch a Coruscant city block in seconds.
Impressive.
Indeed, my lord. Problem is, we're about to become targets.
Forget sunsets. The scorched atmosphere really brings out the beauty of Makeb.
How lovely.
Yes, I--I suppose that's the silver lining, my lord.
Weapon that powerful could solve a lot of problems.
I want one.
Trouble is, the satellites are solving problems for the enemy.
The Republic's evacuating Makeb, and they don't even know we're here. The Hutt Cartel must be firing the satellites.
This reeks of the Hutts.
Slugs playing with orbital lasers. Exactly what I'm afraid of.
What weapons satellites?
Weapons satellites?
The Hutt Cartel, Republic forces, a planet two seconds from collapse--and now lasers raining from the sky.
Makeb keeps getting worse.
Just like the brochures.
We're looking at Argent Sky Lancers, class-nine orbital lasers. Lethal, sophisticated, designed to fire on approaching ships. Someone just flipped 'em around.
If the Archon gets desperate, he could turn those satellites on the drill platforms. That happens, we can kiss Makeb goodbye--along with all that isotope-5.
The Empire has invested too much in this planet to let everything slip away now.
We will not lose Makeb.
Glad to hear some confidence over the general panic.
No Hutt's going to destroy a whole planet on my watch.
I won't let that happen.
Pleased to hear it, hunter.
There must be some way to disable these Sky Lancers from the ground.
How do we stop the satellites?
I traced the orbital signals to a planetary facility. That's where we'll hit them.
A few lost drill platforms won't doom the entire planet.
Let the Archon try.
Katha Niar flagged those drills as vital to Makeb's preservation. We better play it safe.
The Sky Lancer control center's nearby. Mercs captured the civilian crew inside and are forcing 'em to operate the weaponry. No one else on Makeb knows how.
Eliminate the civilian operators and the controls, and those satellites won't harm a mynock.
Transmit the command center's coordinates. We'll take it from here.
We're on our way.
Location uploaded, but I wouldn't rush off too fast.
Mercenaries are one thing, but I'd rather avoid killing the innocent.
Must we kill civilians?
Smash the controls, and we'll be safe enough, I suppose.
The Sky Lancer control center's crawling with mercs. Outside, you've got another problem: probe droids.
One probe signals the base, and the entire facility locks down. Then you'll never disable the satellites.
Technological defenses will not stop the Emperor's Wrath, Sergeant.
A simple obstacle.
Of course, my lord.
Imagine the mercenaries' embarrassment when a member of the Dark Council drops in unannounced.
I can't wait to surprise them.
The looks on their faces will be priceless, my lord.
Destroy probe droids, storm the control center, eliminate satellite operators. Simple enough job.
I'll handle it.
Perfect. Compensation's delivered once the weapons go dark.
Avoiding detection is my specialty, Sergeant. I'll have those satellites offline shortly.
The probes won't ever spot me.
Very good, Commander.
If you're holding back any more vital details, now's the time to spill them.
Anything else?
I'm all out of intel.
Good luck. Anything goes wrong, and those Sky Lancer satellites could destroy everything we've worked for.
I'm leaving, Sergeant. Talk only gives our enemy time to prepare their next strike.
You're wasting valuable time.
One more request, and I'll throw you from this mesa.
Don't try my patience.
As insightful as this chat has been, I think I can handle some rudimentary security.
This briefing is over.
Keep talking. I won't be around to hear it.
Shut up already.
Of course, I--I'm sorry. Good luck!
Let the experts take this mission while I save Makeb.
Send black ops. [Refuse quest]
Blasted groundquakes're giving me the heaves.
I'm here to save Makeb, not murder the innocent, Sergeant.
I won't kill civilians.
Very well, my lord. Destroying the mainframe should suffice.
